intro: Haplolobus floribundus subsp. microphyllus, commonly known as the small-leaved flax-leaf heath, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Ericaceae family, which includes shrubs and evergreens adapted to acidic soils. The subspecies is characterized by its small, narrow leaves and clusters of white or pale pink flowers. It typically grows in rocky or sandy soils in open habitats such as fynbos vegetation. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
